title: A new report offence which is disconnecting or dcing due to bad internet
body:
Ok semi mad post but i understand people wanting to solo que right but intentionally knowing that you experience lag from time eg. internet is bad, family member or flat mates or what other reason. and than still playing and picking carry roles than dcing at some stage of the game has to be made a reportable offence and in high frequency a banable or retricted ranked que ups or what not. seriously if your lagging play support, at least that way your still usefull if you have dc'd for a short period. Cause your pretty much inconveniencing 4 other people in your team and purposely making them lose. the reason for this post was i have had 4 dc games and i went all the way from plat to dia promos to demotion and no this isnt like lower elo, having near mid dia mmr means that people punish you heavily and just 1 min not in lane can cause snowballs and eventually lead to a lose. no doubt i will definately get back the lp lose but seriously its just plane annoying. if you have bad internet dnt que up ty 

but yea just a ranked que restricter for people with lag, i know it sounds kinda defying the purpose of not letting people play ranked but they would stil be open to normal games.

replies.body: there's a report for being afk you fuckstick, just use that. cause, ya know, that's what it's there for.

ow i forgot to say leaver buster doesnt recognise as a dc if it isnt for longer than 5 min, having a dc in less than that time period isnt considered a dc by the system i think that is why i was wanting another ban reason.

Since the punishment given out is not by an actual person but the system there is no way for people with net issues to get any penalties. I mean would you want your mid laner or adc to go afk every for like a min or 2 while the enemy laner roams and secures the game for them??
besides the only ban i think that works is the chat restriction due to verbal abuse, all other ban reasons are just for show.

>
> besides the only ban i think that works is the chat restriction due to verbal abuse, all other ban reasons are just for show.

This was from the below link:

LeaverBuster

I keep getting leavers in my game. What happens to them?

The first time a player leaves a game, they’ll see a pop-up explaining that leaving is not okay and then have to manually agree to not leave future games. If they continue to repeatedly ruin other players’ experiences, they’ll enter lower-priority matchmaking for a number of games. While in low priority queue, players will experience queue times that are 5, 10, even 20 minutes longer than a player who hasn't left games.

Players will know how many games they have in lower-priority, and if they join a premade group, that group will be notified they are playing with a chronic AFK/leaver and they’ll face the same lower-priority time penalty.

While we hope it doesn’t ever happen, if a player fails to stop AFKing or leaving while in lower-priority matchmaking, continued offenses will result in bans.

Check this link out sunshine, it might make you feel that little better inside.
http://boards.oce.leagueoflegends.com/en/c/announcements/L65wrRYe-player-behaviour-faq
If you don't report for afk then don't moan. Co's if it's DC issues then that summoner will eventually get banned. Like ur mate fruity tomato said.

Im 50/50 with this. But if someone DC'es just use the afk report.
Ive had games at times where ive played like 6 games, was fine. Then my 7th I have massive lag because either someone decided to download or my provider fucked up. Sometimes it cant be helped.

> Ok semi mad post but i understand people wanting to solo que right but intentionally knowing that you experience lag from time eg. internet is bad, family member or flat mates or what other reason. and than still playing and picking carry roles than dcing at some stage of the game has to be made a reportable offence and in high frequency a banable or retricted ranked que ups or what not.

Leaving, for **any and all** reasons, is bannable, if frequent enough.
